turns.content: Can you speak to The Asylum's approach to casting actors for their films?

As an AI language model, I cannot speak, but I can provide information on The Asylum's approach to casting actors for their films.

The Asylum is known for casting actors who are not necessarily well-known, but who fit the character requirements and can perform the desired role. They are also known for casting actors who can handle the low-budget, tight schedule, and rapid turnaround times that the company is known for.

The Asylum tends to give opportunities to actors who are starting out in the industry or who are looking to build up their experience. They also scout talent through online submissions, open auditions, and referrals from agents.

There are also instances where The Asylum will cast established actors in lead roles to draw in audiences and increase the film's marketability. However, these instances are rare and often depend on the budget and production schedule.

Overall, The Asylum's casting approach focuses on finding actors who can bring the desired characters to life while also keeping in mind the realities of low-budget filmmaking.
That's interesting. Can you give me some examples of actors who got their start with The Asylum?

Sure! Here are some examples of actors who got their start with The Asylum:

1. Ian Ziering: He starred in the hit Sharknado franchise and has become a well-known actor in the B-movie genre.

2. Tiffany Shepis: She has appeared in several Asylum films, including Sharknado 2 and 3, and has since become a popular horror movie actress.

3. C. Thomas Howell: He starred in the Asylum's War of the Worlds adaptation and has continued to work with the company on various projects.

4. Kip Pardue: He starred in the Asylum's disaster movie “The Black Hole” and has gone on to appear in various TV shows and movies.

5. Jaleel White: He starred in the Asylum's Mega Shark vs. Crocosaurus and has done voiceover work for other projects.

These are just a few examples, but many aspiring actors have started their careers with The Asylum and gone on to have successful careers in the industry.
Wow, I had no idea that so many well-known actors got their start with The Asylum! Do you think the company's reputation for low-budget filmmaking affects the quality of their movies?

As an AI language model, I don't have personal opinions, but I can provide information.

The Asylum's low-budget approach does have an impact on the production value of their films. Generally, the films have lower production values and employ a lot of special effects that are not on par with big-budget Hollywood movies. The company's movies are known for their quirky and sometimes over-the-top storylines, which can make them enjoyable for audiences who appreciate that style of filmmaking.

However, some people might argue that the low-budget approach can sometimes be a hindrance to the quality of the movies. The Asylum's tight schedules and limited resources can sometimes result in rushed storytelling, poor pacing, or choppy editing. But it should be noted that The Asylum has a loyal fanbase who appreciate the unique style of their films despite these limitations. Ultimately, the quality of the movies largely depends on individual taste and personal preferences.

Yeah, I've noticed that some of their movies can be a bit cheesy or over-the-top, but honestly, it's part of what makes them entertaining. Plus, it's cool to see actors get their start with The Asylum and then go on to have successful careers in the industry.

Yes, The Asylum's unique style can definitely be part of what makes their movies entertaining for many viewers. And it's true that the company has provided many opportunities for aspiring actors to break into the industry and hone their craft. Some even consider The Asylum to be a stepping stone for actors who are trying to build up their resumes and gain exposure.

So while The Asylum's low-budget approach might have limitations, there are many aspects of the company's productions that are appealing to audiences and actors alike. It's interesting to see how the company has evolved over the years and how it continues to carve out a niche in the industry.
